synthesis.method: A methanol solution of 4,4'-dipyridylacetylene and a methanol solution of Ni(BF4)2·xH2O and (NH4)2TiF6 were mixed at room temperature, then the mixtures were settled for 4 h. The obtained sample was exchanged with methanol for 1 day.

PXRD.details: Cu Kα λ = 1.540598 Ǻ, operating power of 40 KV, 30mA, scan speed of 4.0°/min, range of 2θ from 5° to 60°.

SEM.details: acceleration voltage of 3 kV, magnification of 15000, working distance of 7400 um, emission current of 13700 nA.

gas_adsorption_measurements.details: Sample was evacuated at room temperature for 1-2 days until the pressure dropped below 7μm Hg. Sorption isotherms were collected at 273~313 K on activated samples.

TGA.details: Under nitrogen atmosphere, flow rate of 60 mL/min nitrogen gas or air, temperature range of 50°C to 650°C with a ramp of 20°C /min.

VTPXRD.details: CuKα radiation (1.5406 Å), continuous scan from 5 to 60° with a minimum step size of 0.01° at different temperatures.

accelerated_stability_measurements.details: Exposed to air with a temperature of 20°C to 25°C and a humidity of 65–75% for several days. Characterized by PXRD and surface area measurements.

calculation_of_isosteric_heat_of_adsorpt.details: Using a virial-type expression and dual-site Langmuir-Freundlich equation for fitting the single-component C2H2 and C2H4 adsorption isotherm data.

IAST_calculations_of_adsorption_selectiv.details: Dual-site Langmuir-Freundlich equation used for fitting the single-component C2H2 and C2H4 adsorption isotherm data. Selectivity calculated by IAST.

DFT-D_calculations.details: Performed using the Quantum-Espresso package. A semi-empirical addition of dispersive forces to conventional DFT-D was included to account for van der Waals interactions.

column_breakthrough_experiments_for_C2H2.details: Stainless-steel column (4.6 mm inner diameter × 50 mm), weight of TIFSIX-2-Ni-i powder was 0.303 g, activated with He flow (15 mL/min) for 12 h at room temperature (25 °C). Mixed gas (C2H2/C2H4: 1/99, v/v) flow introduced at 1.25 mL/min. Outlet gas monitored using gas chromatography (GC-8A, SHIMADZU) with a flame ionization detector (FID).
